args: Oh, nooo! I put so much WORK\ninto my Piriara lightblooms...
Aeleen? Did I hear you saying\nsomething about Piriara lightblooms?

Oh, hello, Sophie! Good ear. There's a
terribly valuable medicinal component
that can be extracted from them, so I
had hoped to grow a batch, but...well...

Ah. They're withering. It is no wonder,
though. Even amongst mana researchers,
these flowers have a reputation for being
notoriously difficult to cultivate.

Regulating their mana flow is a
temperamental process, to be sure.
If even experts struggle with it, I suppose
I'd be wise to quit while I'm ahead.
Actually, I may be able to help with that.
Permit me to manage their mana. \nI've taken something of a personal\ninterest in seeing them bloom.
Really?! Your help would be invaluable!
It'd be my pleasure. And with that,\nlet's get right down to brass tacks!
Phew... I think that ought to get\nthem back in fighting shape.
Absolutely amazing! I'd never have\nexpected that to work so flawlessly.
Mana has a symbiotic relationship with\nthe bodies and spirits of living creatures.

For example, negative emotions like
anger or sadness can cause mana to
become clouded, which can bleed over
into nearby organisms.
(Could the flowers have been withering\nbecause I sometimes turn into that\nsuper rage-y version of myself?!)

Building upon the inverse of that concept,
I've cleared up the mana around here so
as to allow kind feelings to infuse them
with newfound strength.
If we suffuse this entire field with positive\nenergy, I'm quite certain we'll end up with\nlovely flowers budding before long.
(Agh, just when I thought my violent side\ncouldn't be any more of a hindrance!)
Oh, uh, yes! Of course! Through mana, the\nfeelings of a kind heart can be conveyed\nto the flowers, and that's key, right?

I'm going to do everything I can to
sequester that shamefully barbaric part
of my personality so that these flowers
can blossom happily and healthily!
I've gotten a lot better at controlling\nit lately, so I know I can do this.
Er, good for you...? Well, do your best,\nbut be mindful of your limits, Aeleen.
From that point on, I took great pains to\nkeep the figurative beast within quelled.
Even when a fiend barged in right as I was\npatching someone up—
Okay, I'll treat this wound right away!\nPain, pain, begone...

UGH, SHUT UP! I'm tryin' to treat an
injury, you wretched, no-good—ACK!
No! Deep breaths, Aeleen. Go to your
happy place...
I know just what to do. I'll turn to the\npower of medicinal herbs. A little pinch\nof paralytic powder for you, and...behave!
Even when I got mixed up with some\nsketchy folks while I was out stocking up—
Hey there, little lady. Ain't YOU a peach?\nHow's about you come have some fun with\nus?
Say WHAT?! How DARE you pus-faced little\nsons of—ack! No! Sorry, I'm in a hurry!
Daaamn, that lady is FAST! She some\nkinda humanoid-roadrunner hybrid?
Anyway, I got through it all! And before long, my\nefforts paid off—the flowers grew up lickety-split!
You did it, Aeleen! The Piriara\nlightblooms are budding.\nMy, aren't they resplendent?
Couldn't have done it without you, Sophie.\nAll I need to do now is keep my cool until\nthey blossom. I've got this in the bag!
So long as you aren't pushing yourself too\nhard. I worry about you, Ael—EYAAAGH!
A bear?! And it looks frenzied.\nWhat in the world drew it here?
I don't rightly know, but whatever the\nreason, this is dangerous. It's looking to\nmake a mess of the medicinal plant field!
How DARE you! I'M GONNA SKIN YOU\nALIVE AND WEAR YOU OUT OF HERE!
After all the effort I put into AVOIDING\ndanger! Aeleen... And in front of all\nthe lightblossoms, of all places!
It's over. I might've protected them from\nthe bear, but thanks to my violent heart,\nthe buds have to be good as doomed.
I can't believe this is how things shook out\nafter everything you did to help, Sophie.\nI'm so tired of dealing with this!
I owe you an apology, Aeleen.

All this time, I've been concerned that
you seemed to be pushing yourself for
some reason... Now I see it was caused
by a misunderstanding.
Yep. You're operating under the\nmisunderstanding that you have an\nunkind heart.
The mana I observed in you was nothing\nbut positive. It never wavered. Go on,\ntake a look at the flowers you protected.
But they're sure to be all withered—oh!
They're... They're blossoming!\nEvery single one! How?
Because your heart is kind, of course.\nYou summoned all your bravery\nspecifically to keep the flowers safe.

Someone who acts with such a pure
desire to protect could never be unkind.
The flowers responded to your gentle
spirit, and the result blooms before you.
You're saying I made them bloom?!

That you did. So please, don't disparage
the quirks that make you who you are.
I truly like seeing that passionate side
of you come out at times, Aeleen.
Sophie... You really are one of a kind.\nI think I might...be about to cry a little.
Hearing you say that you accept me for\nwho I am makes me a little less ashamed\nof my outbursts.
Is that all it took? Then I'll remind you of\nthat as many times as it takes—every day,\nif I must! I merely speak the truth.
As I observed your mana during your\ntime cultivating the lightblossoms, it\nwas always kind, and as pure as can be.
I'll remind you of that whenever the\nspecter of self-doubt starts to creep in.\nAnything to keep you smiling.
...! Um, thank you, Sophie.\nThat makes me truly happy to hear.
Because of you, the flowers have bloomed\nand I've gained another wonderful friend.\nMaybe I really can accept my dark side.
And on that note, I have a request.
The next time you want to grow some\nlightblooms, please let me help too.
But of course! We'll sow the seeds of\nsomething truly beautiful—of that I'm sure.
